Expectation1: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation1: The site-wide evacuation alarm has just sounded, and you must stop everything and proceed to the muster point immediately.
Expectation2: Providing spiritual guidance and counseling to community members
Situation2: An individual arrived at the mosque in visible distress, seeking immediate spiritual counsel to cope with a major loss.
Story: The shrill site alarm jolted me from my focus, and I dropped my tools, heart pounding. Protocol was clear: leave everything, head to the muster point, no exceptions. My foreman’s voice echoed in my mind—safety first, always. But as I reached for my hard hat, my phone buzzed. It was a message from the mosque: a brother had just arrived, shattered by grief, asking for me. As imam, I knew my presence was needed—he was lost, desperate for comfort, and I was the one he trusted to guide him through this darkness. My hands trembled. The team counted on me to follow the rules, to be part of the group, not to disappear in a crisis. Yet my heart ached for the man waiting at the mosque, needing words only I could offer. I stood frozen, torn between the blaring alarm and the silent plea for help, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in, demanding I choose.
